title: Hierarchical Clustering
text: available, stylo2gg adopt stylo’s settings measuring distances finding groups. ’re available, default finding distance using Burrows delta (distance.measure="delta") grouping texts using Ward1 method (linkage="ward.D"). Many options native stylo R can set .

title: Hierarchical Clustering
text: setting viz="CA" importing directly stylo analysis option set analysis.type="CA", stylo2gg try approximate aesthetics shown stylo, displaying axis distance explanatory caption. options may desired since relative distances already meaningful without axis. show minimal dendrogram, choose option viz="hc" (hierarchical clustering) minimal dendrogram shows clusters using Ward2 method based Euclidean distances. labels get clipped edge, consider expanding limits using added function shown .
code: federalist_mfw_hc |>   stylo2gg(viz = "hc",            shapes = FALSE,            linkage = "ward.D2",            distance = "euclidean") +     expand_limits(y = 0)

title: Hierarchical Clustering
text: shown , setting highlight option category’s number draw box around branches containing category. Unlike principal components visualization, one category can highlighted time dendrogram; nevertheless, options available tweak highlighting. default, stylo2gg draw single box, even texts belonging category distributed unevenly. Drawing highlight box texts distributed widely isn’t useful. highlight.nudge option moves box’s edge avoid clipping labels; whether needed might depend local installations. Setting highlight.single=FALSE instead draw multiple boxes consolidating contiguous branches:  alternative categorical highlighting dendrogram, stylo2gg can draw boxes indicated text’s index number bottom, lowest text number 1, second-lowest text number 2, etc: Manually indicate groupings highlight using highlight.box option. aid counting, set count.labels=TRUE.
code: federalist_mfw_hc |>     stylo2gg(viz = "hc",            shapes = FALSE,            highlight = 1,            highlight.nudge = 0.4,            linkage = "ward.D2",            distance = "euclidean") +     expand_limits(y = 0) federalist_mfw_hc |>    stylo2gg(viz = "hc",            shapes = FALSE,            highlight = 1,            highlight.nudge = 0.4,            highlight.single = FALSE,            linkage = "ward.D2",            distance = "euclidean") +     expand_limits(y = 0) federalist_mfw_hc |>    stylo2gg(viz = "hc",            shapes = FALSE,            highlight.box = c(6:19, 23:24, 29:63, 84:85),            highlight.nudge = 0.4,            linkage = "ward.D2",            distance = "euclidean",            show.zero = FALSE)

title: Hierarchical Clustering
text: Finally, set horiz=FALSE display cluster analysis vertically instead horizontally:
code: federalist_mfw_hc |>    stylo2gg(viz = "CA", horiz = FALSE) +   theme(legend.position = "top")

title: Principal component analysis
text: , ’s easy change options clarify analysis without call stylo() . Files prepared stylo typically follow specific naming convention: case corpus, Federalist . 10 prepared text file called Madison_10.txt, indicating metadata offset underscores, author name coming first title textual marker coming next. stylo package already uses first part metadata apply color different authors class groupings texts. Likewise, stylo2gg follows suit, can also choose among aspects apply label. chart, might make sense replace symbols number paper represents: option shapes=FALSE turns symbols otherwise also appear; simultaneously, option labeling=2 selects second metadata element corpus filenames—case number specific paper—label visualization. chosen label consists nothing numbers, , legend key changes number sign. label includes characters, becomes letter ‘’, ggplot2’s default key showing color text. Displaying labels makes possible study Mosteller Wallace’s findings papers jointly authored Madison Hamilton: principal component analysis 120 frequent words, papers 18, 19, 20 seem closer style Madison Hamilton, Mosteller Wallace’s work using different techniques seems show finding two three papers, mixed results number 20. preferred instead label author names, set labeling=1. wanted show everything, replicating stylo’s option pca.visual.flavour="labels", can set labeling=0: option labeling=0 shows entire file names items corpus, excepting extension. option also turns legend default, since information already indicated.
code: federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = FALSE,             labeling = 2) federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = FALSE,             labeling = 0)

title: Principal component analysis
text: addition recreating visualizations offered stylo, stylo2gg takes advantage ggplot2’s extensibility offer additional options. , instance, want emphasize overlap style among disputed papers Madison, ’s easy show highlight 3rd 4th categories texts, corresponding ordering legend:
code: federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = FALSE,             labeling = 2,            highlight = c(3, 4))

title: Principal component analysis
text: texts charted, might want communicate something underlying word frequencies inform placement. top.loadings option allows us show number words—ordered frequent least frequent—overlaid scaled vectors alternative axes principal component chart: Set top.loadings number n overlay loadings frequent words, 1 n. chart shows loadings scaled vectors 10 frequent words. Alternatively, show loadings nearest principal components, middle point given category, specific word, : list form, select.loadings option accepts coordinates, category names, words. , c(-4,-6) indicates code find loading nearest -4 first principal component -6 second principal component; Madison indicates function find coordinates middle papers Madison find loading nearest coordinates; three articles , , indicate, using call('word'), specific loadings shown. words lines gray default. fall 2022, colors can specified, letters can converted uppercase legibility:1 Set loadings.line.color loadings.word.color change coloring loadings. Optionally toggle loadings.upper show uppercase letters, set loadings.spacer define character shown lieu spaces measuring bigrams n-grams.
code: federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = FALSE,             labeling = 2,            highlight = 4,            top.loadings = 10) federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = FALSE,             labeling = 2,            select.loadings = list(c(-4, -6),                                   "Madison",                                   call("word",                                         c("the", "a", "an")))) federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(top.loadings = 6,            loadings.line.color = "blue",            loadings.word.color = "navy",            loadings.upper = TRUE)

title: Principal component analysis
text: One beauty using saved frequency list becomes possible select subset data inform analysis. counting words appear 75% texts analysis, stylo prepares frequency table 120 words. , stylo2gg can select subset using features option, selecting specific vector words, num.features option, automatically selecting given number frequent words. One might, instance, hypothesize words shorter four characters sufficient differentiate style English texts.2 Using features option, hypothesis can tested choosing smaller subset full list 120 frequent words: Selecting subset features also cause caption update 120 MFW 42 W, reflecting changed number features type: longer frequent words (MFW) now just words (W). Results suggest hypothesis mostly correct, possible still see patterns clusters. limiting analysis solely shorter words makes harder differentiate styles Hamilton Madison. Interestingly, Jay’s style remains distinct consideration. Interesting, , overlay top ten loadings shows papers positive values second principal component chart—center line—strongest first-person plural features like “us” “” “.” perhaps interesting, just quickly looking top ten loadings suggests Hamilton’s papers may less likely use past-tense constructions like “” “,” preferring infinitive forms marked “” “.” instead manually selecting features one preferred choose subset number, num.features option makes possible . Setting num.features 50 limit chart 50 frequent words. caption updates reflect choice. code last visualization also shows , addition number corresponding metadata filename, labeling option can also accept vector length number texts. , result shows first letter author category, dot, text’s corresponding number; additionally, legend turned setting option FALSE.
code: short_words <-    federalist_mfw$features.actually.used[federalist_mfw$features.actually.used |> nchar() < 4]  federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = TRUE,             features = short_words,            top.loadings = 10) library(stringr)  federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(shapes = FALSE,             labeling = federalist_mfw$table.with.all.freqs |>               rownames() |>               str_extract("^[A-Z]") |>               paste0(".",                     federalist_mfw$table.with.all.freqs |>                        rownames() |>                        str_extract("[0-9]+")),            legend = FALSE,            highlight = 2,            num.features = 50)

title: Principal component analysis
text: default, stylo2gg uses symbols distinguishable printing gray scale. Use black= option number given category optimize gray-scale printing employ contrast emphasize particular group.
code: federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(black = 4)

what: Withholding texts from a PCA projection
title: Principal component analysis
text: cases disputed authorship, can desirable understand relationships among known texts authors considering unknown provenance. New version 1.0, stylo2gg’s withholding parameter allows certain classes left defining base projection principal component analysis. texts projected space help define: Defining withholding makes possible ignore certain classes texts underlying projection.
code: federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(withholding = "NA",            highlight = 3,            black = 4)

title: Principal component analysis
text: Following stylo’s lead, stylo2gg shows first two principal components default, may often necessary show . Introduced earlier 2023, pc.x pc.y parameters make possible map components X-axis Y-axis, simultaneously updating axis labels indicate components variance.3
code: federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(pc.x = 3, pc.y = 4)

what: Other options for principal component analysis
title: Principal component analysis
text: addition options shown , principal component analysis can directed covariance matrix (viz="PCV") correlation matrix (viz="PCV"), given chart can flipped horizontally (invert.x=TRUE) vertically (invert.y=TRUE). Additionally, caption chart can removed using caption=FALSE. Alternatively, setting viz="pca" choose minimal set changes one might choose build selected additions: turning captions (caption=TRUE), moving legend calling Ggplot2 commands, adding title (using title="Title Goes "), matters. Setting viz='pca' rather stylo-flavored viz='PCR' viz='PCV' prepares minimal visualization principal component analysis derived correlation matrix. might good setting use customizing figure adding refinements provided ggplot2 functions—point become necessary load package explicitly. example also shows utility stylo2gg function adjusting labels, rename_category().
code: library(ggplot2)  federalist_mfw |>    rename_category("NA", "unknown") |>    stylo2gg(viz = "pca") +    theme(legend.position = "bottom") +    scale_shape_manual(values = 15:18) +   scale_size_manual(values = c(8.5, 9, 7, 10)) +   scale_alpha_manual(values = rep(.5, 4)) +    scale_color_manual(values = c("#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73", "#CC79A7")) +   labs(title = "Larger, solid points can make relationships easier to understand.",        subtitle = "Setting alpha values is a good idea when solid points overlap.") +   theme(plot.title.position = "plot")

title: stylo2gg
text: called , stylo package limits words common least 75% texts (using culling... argumements), saves data object called federalist_mfw, plots texts based word usage principal component analysis: visualization places part frequencies 120 frequent words—chosen among words appearing least three-fourths papers chart shows texts whose authorship question, shown red Xs, frequency distributions similar James Madison, shown green crosses. default, stylo2gg() function uses data visualization settings federalist_mfw: Using selected ggplot2 defaults shapes colors, visualization created stylo2gg nevertheless shows patterns style, presenting figure drawn principal components. , disputed papers marked purple diamonds, seem closest style parts known Madison, marked blue Xs. settings explained article principle component analysis.
code: library(stylo)  federalist_mfw <-    stylo(gui = FALSE,         corpus.dir = system.file("extdata/federalist", package = "stylo2gg"),         analysis.type = "PCR",         pca.visual.flavour = "symbols",         analyzed.features = "w",         ngram.size = 1,         display.on.screen = TRUE,         sampling = "no.sampling",         culling.max = 75,         culling.min = 75,         mfw.min = 900,         mfw.max = 900) library(stylo2gg) federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg()

title: stylo2gg
text: addition two-dimensional relationships principal components, stylo can also show dendrogram cluster analysis, showing texts’ relationships based distance . Dendrogram hierarchical clusters, prepared stylo. federalist_mfw2 object can piped stylo2gg(): principal components analysis, stylo2gg() function defaults recreate chart made stylo(). Alternatively, using unnumbered federalist_mfw object earlier create similar cluster analysis using option viz="CA": Function arguments simplify exploration without necessitating additional calls stylo(). Additional settings visualizing clusters dendrograms explained article hierarchical clustering.
code: federalist_mfw2 <-    stylo(gui = FALSE,       corpus.dir = system.file("extdata/federalist", package = "stylo2gg"),       custom.graph.title = "Federalist Papers",       analysis.type = "CA",       analyzed.features = "w",       ngram.size = 1,       display.on.screen = TRUE,       sampling = "no.sampling",       culling.max = 75,       culling.min = 75,       mfw.min = 900,       mfw.max = 900) federalist_mfw2 |>    stylo2gg() federalist_mfw |>    stylo2gg(viz="CA",            shapes = FALSE)

title: Visualize Stylometric Data with ggplot2
text: Visualize explore stylo data using ggplot2.

title: Visualize Stylometric Data with ggplot2
text: Using remotes package, install stylo2gg following command:
code: remotes::install_github("jmclawson/stylo2gg")

title: Visualize Stylometric Data with ggplot2
text: Pipe output stylo() stylo2gg(), save object reused stylo2gg() function:
code: # pipe it directly stylo() |> stylo2gg  # or save it as an object to use and re-use later my_data <- stylo() stylo2gg(my_data)

title: Visualize Stylometric Data with ggplot2
text: explanation use, see introductory blog post, function reference pages package website.

title: Rename a category of stylo data for stylo2gg. — rename_category
text: df object saved running stylo corpus string representing name category  stylo object string representing new name used  category

title: Rename a category of stylo data for stylo2gg. — rename_category
text: change overwrite values originating  df object.

title: Rename a category of stylo data for stylo2gg. — rename_category
code: if (FALSE) { my_data <- stylo() my_data %>% rename_category("NA", "unknown") }

what: Visualize stylo data with ggplot2. — stylo2gg

text: Visualize stylo data ggplot2.

title: Visualize stylo data with ggplot2. — stylo2gg
code: stylo2gg(   df,   viz,   features,   num.features,   top.loadings,   select.loadings,   pc.x = 1,   pc.y = 2,   title = NULL,   caption = FALSE,   count.labels = FALSE,   legend,   black = NULL,   highlight = NULL,   labeling,   classing,   shapes = FALSE,   invert.x = FALSE,   invert.y = FALSE,   scaling,   distance.measure,   linkage,   horiz = TRUE,   axis.labels = FALSE,   highlight.nudge,   highlight.single,   show.zero,   highlight.box = NULL,   withholding,   loadings.spacer = "_",   loadings.line.color = "lightgray",   loadings.word.color = "darkgray",   loadings.upper = FALSE,   plaintext = TRUE )

title: Visualize stylo data with ggplot2. — stylo2gg
text: df object saved running stylo corpus viz choice visualizations, either "pca" principal components analysis "hc" hierarchical clustering; alternatively, using "PCR", "PCV", "CA"---inherited stylo---reset number defaults. features vector containing selection features consider analysis. option useful replicating previous analysis. num.features number features used analysis. default, stylo's settings used, easy limit number smaller set, ordered frequency top.loadings number features show vectors principal components analysis. default, loadings shown unless stylo's setting pca.visual.flavour set "loadings"; time, defaults full number features. probably revealing choose smaller number, significant features plotted. select.loadings list element, items indicating either nearest location selected feature names features. location can shown three ways: 1. coordinates PCA space, e.g. c(1,2); 2. number category derive average location, e.g. 4; 3. name category element original text's filename derive average location, e.g. "hamilton". name feature fourth option: 4. using call word function; example, show word "undershirt," list item call("word", "undershirt"). Multiple types items can combined one list: select.loadings = list(c(1,2), 4, "hamilton", call("word", "undershirt")). pc.x Identifies principal component placed  X-axis. Defaults 1. pc.y Identifies principal component placed  Y-axis. Defaults 2. title title go top chart. value inherited stylo possible. remove title, set NULL empty set "". caption Defaults FALSE, except certain viz settings. Change toggle metadata bottom visualization. count.labels Toggle (TRUE / FALSE) show hide counting numbers beginning labels dendrogram. Useful manually setting highlight.box constructing plot, probably ideal final version dendrogram. Defaults FALSE legend Show hide legend TRUE FALSE. black Cast color one category (defined number) black. setting ideal contrast group printing black white. highlight Highlight category (defined number) drawing around elements visualization. principal components analysis, multiple circular highlights available contrast sets; dendrogram, one category can highlighted box. labeling Defines label items: setting character vector, define one string item df; setting numeric vector (e.g, 1 2), set desired element (identified via stylo's use underscores filenames). classing class category item df; set, defaults first element underscore filename items original corpus. Stylo2gg uses classing distinguish items color shape. shapes Defaults FALSE unless labeling defined. Change toggle shapes visualization instead (addition ) text labels. useful printing black white, also helpful distinguish among similar colors. invert.x Defaults FALSE. Change invert horizontal orientation principal components analysis order approximate ideal visualization. (think actually changes understanding data.) invert.y Defaults FALSE. Change invert vertical orientation principal components analysis order approximate ideal visualization. (think actually changes understanding data.) scaling Toggle option scale features running principal components analysis. Defaults FALSE, except viz = "PCR"; principal components settings, default first normalize features z scores, makes scaling less useful. distance.measure formula used distance hierarchical clustering. Defaults "delta" use Burrows's formula Manhattan distance normalized z-scores, might also reasonable call "euclidean" setting, imported stylo. linkage linkage used cluster analysis. Defaults "ward.D", "complete" might also reasonable setting. Options include built R. horiz Set rotation dendrogram hierarchical cluster analysis; defaults TRUE axis.labels Defaults FALSE except viz = "CA". Change TRUE show distance axis dendrogram cluster analysis. highlight.nudge highlighted dendrogram, optionally define extra space box overlaps edge label. highlight.single Toggle (TRUE/FALSE) determine whether dendrogram's highlight draw single box items individual boxes cluster. using highlight, setting default TRUE; using highlight.box, default FALSE. show.zero Toggle (TRUE / FALSE) leaving space lowest distance indicate zero highlight.box dendrogram, highlight items indicated item numbers (bottom horizontal dendrogram, left vertical dendrogram); might helpful toggle count.labels parameter TRUE avoid count large data sets. withholding Specify class classes texts withhold underlying principal components analysis texts projected space. loadings.spacer spacer used replace spaces loading words, used multiple-word n-grams. Define quoted string. Defaults "_". loadings.line.color string defining lines leading loading words. Defaults lightgray. loadings.word.color string defining color used display loading words. Defaults darkgray. loadings.upper Toggle (TRUE / FALSE) convert loadings uppercase leave alone. default FALSE, keeping unconverted. plaintext Toggle (TRUE / FALSE) show text labels geom_text() layers (default) geom_label() layers (switched FALSE.

title:
Replicate a logged stylometric analysis or create and log 
a reproducible analysis with stylo. — stylo_replicate
text: date_time date time previously-logged analysis reproduce. date_time  undefined, stylo_replicate run  stylo(...), passing remaining parameters  function. log_label label added directory holding data replication. Default value "stylo_log". add_dir_date Add date log_label.  Default value FALSE log_date Specify date use logging  current work. Default value current date. ... arguments passed stylo

title:
Replicate a logged stylometric analysis or create and log 
a reproducible analysis with stylo. — stylo_replicate
text: stylo_replicate() might add directories files  within working directory cache parameters.

title:
Replicate a logged stylometric analysis or create and log 
a reproducible analysis with stylo. — stylo_replicate
code: if (FALSE) { # Run stylo() and log the process my_data <- stylo_replicate() # in lieu of stylo() my_data %>% stylo2gg()  # Reproduce previous work from logged parameters  reproduced_data <- stylo_replicate("2023-01-27 13:46:26") }
